title: Safety and Efficacy of Donepezil in Mild to Moderate Alzheimer's Disease: A Multi-center Single-arm Study in China
description_brief: This study will evaluate the safety and Efficacy of donepezil in treatment of AD patients in China.
description_detailed: This study is a multi-center, single-arm, open labeling clinical trial, which the objective is to evaluate the safety and Efficacy of donepezil in Alzheimer's disease( AD) patients in China, and investigate the relationship between Apo-E gene type with adverse events of donepezil.

groups.title: Donepezil
groups.description: Each enrolled patient received donepezil 10 mg/day (Aricept, two 5 mg-pills, Eisai China Inc, SuZhou, China) every night before sleeping for 20 weeks. If a patient could not tolerate 10 mg/day, the dosage for the patient could be reduced to 5 mg/day for 4 weeks and then increased back to 10 mg/day. If this patient still could not tolerate the 10 mg/day dosage and returned back to 5 mg/day or discontinued the donepezil treatment, he/she should be deemed to have quit the study.

dropWithdraws.type: Failure to up-titrate to 10mg/day: 12 patients; Other reasons: 30 patients

measures.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measures.populationDescription: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measures.title: MMSE
measures.description: MMSE,Mini-Mental State Examination (range 0-30). A higher score indicates better cognitive function.

measures.title: ADCS-ADL(Alzheimer's disease cooperative study - activities of daily living)
measures.description: ADCS-ADL (Alzheimer's disease cooperative study - activities of daily living) score (range 0 to 78), a higher score indicates better ADL function)

measures.title: HAMD
measures.description: HAMD, Hamilton Depression Scale (score range 0 to 52). A score \>7and ≤17 indicates mild depression; a score \>17 and ≤24 indicates moderate depression; and a score \>24 indicates severe depression.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Patients With Adverse Events (AEs)
outcomeMeasures.description: Physical examinations such as vital signs and weight, clinical laboratory tests, and electrocardiograms (ECGs) during the 20 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Patients Who Withdrew From the Trial Due to Adverse Events.
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of patients who withdrew due to adverse events

outcomeMeasures.title: Changes in Mini-Mental State Examination Scores From Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of Mental state examination (MMSE) scores (range 0-30) at 4 weeks and 20 weeks with baseline in mild to moderate AD patients. A higher score indicates better cognitive function.Higher score indicates better cognition function.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription:
241 patients were included in the full analysis set (FAS) and 93 patients who completed the study constituted the per-protocol set (PPS). Therefore, FAS last-observation-carried-forward \[LOCF\] and PPS \[LOCF\] included 241 and 93 patients, respectively.

FAS \[actual data\] at baseline, Week 4 and Week 20 included 238, 145 and 94 patients, respectively.

PPS \[actual data\] at baseline, Week 4 and Week 20 included 148, 113 and 93 patients, respectively.

outcomeMeasures.title: Changes in Alzheimer's Disease Cooperative Study Activities of Daily Living (ADCS-ADL) Scores From Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of Alzheimer's Disease Cooperative Study Activities of Daily Living (ADCS-ADL) scores (range 0-78) at 4 weeks and 20 weeks with baseline scores in patients with mild to moderate Alzheimer's Disease. A higher score indicates better activities of daily living (ADL).
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription:
241 patients were included in the FAS and 93 patients who completed the study constituted the PPS. Therefore, FAS \[LOCF\] and PPS \[LOCF\] included 241 and 93 patients, respectively.

FAS \[actual data\] at baseline, Week 4 and Week 20 all included 42 patients, while PPS \[actual data\] at baseline, Week 4 and Week 20 all included 26 patients

outcomeMeasures.title: Correlation Between Apolipoprotein E.(APOE) Genotype and Incidence of Adverse Events of Donepezil
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of incidence of adverse events among patients with different APOE genotypes
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: 115 patients in the safety set had their APOE gene sequenced and have data on their APOE genotype. Among these patients, 1 carries APOE ɛ2/ɛ2, 58 carry APOE ɛ3/ɛ3, 7 carry APOE ɛ4/ɛ4, 11 carry APOE ɛ2/ɛ3, 1 carries APOE ɛ2/ɛ4, and 37 carry APOE ɛ3/e4.

groups.title: APOE ɛ3/ɛ3 Carriers
groups.description: Number of APOE ɛ3/ ɛ3 carriers

classes.title: Numbe of patients who experienced adverse events
Number of patients who did not experience adverse events

outcomeMeasures.title: APOE Genotype
outcomeMeasures.description:
A patient's APOE genotype (ɛ2/ɛ2, ɛ3/ɛ3, ɛ4/ɛ4, ɛ2/ɛ3, ɛ2/ɛ4 and ɛ3/e4) was tested by tested by Sanger sequencing from blood collected from the the patient at Visit 2.

APOE genotype is not mandatory
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: 115 patients in the study had their APOE genotype tested by Sanger sequencing from blood collected from the the patient at Visit 2.

groups.title: Donepezil
groups.description: Each patient took daily single dose of donepezil 10mg

adverseEventsModule.description: Systematic assessment due to regular investigator assessment at study visits.

pointOfContact.title: Jianping Jia
pointOfContact.organization: Department of Neurology, Xuan Wu Hospital of Capital Medical University; Freindship Hospital of Capital Medical University

explanation_target: Reason: The trial tests donepezil, which is a centrally acting, reversible acetylcholinesterase inhibitor developed to improve cholinergic neurotransmission and thereby cognitive symptoms in Alzheimer's disease — i.e., a symptomatic cognitive enhancer rather than a disease-modifying biologic. citeturn0search3turn0search4

Act: Key details — title and description state this is a multi-center, single-arm study of donepezil for mild-to-moderate AD in China (safety and efficacy). Donepezil is a small-molecule acetylcholinesterase inhibitor (oral tablet/orally disintegrating tablet) used to improve cognition and function in AD but not shown to alter disease progression. Because the drug is a small-molecule symptomatic treatment, it matches the 'cognitive enhancer' category. citeturn0search4turn0search5

Reflect: Evidence from randomized trials and reviews shows modest improvements in cognition, global clinical ratings, and activities of daily living with donepezil, supporting classification as a cognitive enhancer (symptom-targeted). It is not a monoclonal antibody, vaccine, or other biologic nor is it intended primarily to treat neuropsychiatric symptoms — therefore 'cognitive enhancer' is the best-fit category. citeturn0search0turn0search2

Web search results (sources used): 1) Donepezil review describing mechanism as a reversible, non-competitive acetylcholinesterase inhibitor and its symptomatic use in AD. citeturn0search3 2) MedlinePlus patient/drug information noting donepezil controls symptoms but does not cure or prevent progression; formulation and dosing info. citeturn0search4 3) PubMed/Cochrane-style trial/meta-analysis summaries showing modest cognitive and functional benefits in mild-to-moderate AD. citeturn0search0turn0search2 4) Pharmacology review noting donepezil is a synthetic reversible AChE inhibitor (small molecule) with clinical efficacy in AD. citeturn0search5
explanation_agent: Reason: The trial tests donepezil (Aricept), a centrally acting, reversible acetylcholinesterase inhibitor developed to improve cholinergic neurotransmission and thereby cognitive symptoms in Alzheimer’s disease; this is a symptomatic, neurotransmitter-modulating treatment rather than a disease-modifying biologic. citeturn0search4turn0search1

Act: Key details from the description — multi-center single-arm safety and efficacy study of donepezil for mild-to-moderate AD. Donepezil is a small-molecule acetylcholinesterase inhibitor that increases synaptic acetylcholine to enhance cholinergic neurotransmission and cognition; this mechanism maps to CADRO’s Neurotransmitter Receptors category (agents that modulate neurotransmitter systems). citeturn0search4turn0search5

Reflect: Classification check — the intervention targets the cholinergic neurotransmitter system (enzyme inhibition to boost acetylcholine) and is a symptomatic cognitive enhancer, not an anti-amyloid, anti-tau, anti-inflammatory, vascular, or multi-target disease-modifying therapy; therefore D) Neurotransmitter Receptors is the most specific CADRO match. Evidence summaries and reviews report modest cognitive/functional benefit consistent with a symptomatic cholinergic agent. citeturn0search1turn0search3

Web search results used (key sources): 1) Cochrane review summarizing donepezil benefits in AD (moderate-quality evidence for small cognitive/functional improvements). citeturn0search1 2) PubMed/systematic-review summaries on donepezil efficacy in mild–moderate AD and its mechanism as a cholinesterase inhibitor. citeturn0search4 3) Additional Cochrane/evidence summaries on donepezil and cholinesterase inhibitors (mechanism and symptomatic use). citeturn0search3turn0search5
